string-array.name: marriage
string-array.item: The mission of the SNMC Matchmaking Service is to provide a safe, friendly, and halal platform for single Muslims to find a potential spouse. SNMC Matchmaking offers the perfect setting and guidance for single Muslims and their families to meet and interact with others, within Islamic boundaries. The program aims to develop long-lasting marriages.

string-array.name: family
string-array.item: Couple Counseling: In a situation where couples need advice from an Imam, the hours for counseling are on Wednesday and Thursday between 6:00 pm and 8:00 pm. \n Domestic Violence: SNMC will provide guidance from Islamic sources which very clearly indicate that any violence, including the domestic, is abhorred and condemned in Islam. \n Family Islamic Reconciliation: Whenever the conflict appears among the family members, the Imam will help by providing Islamic arbitration and reconciliation.

SNMC Seniors Weekly Program: Weekly Yoga 
Day and Time: Every Wednesday from 11 am - 12 pm

SNMC Seniors Monthly Program 
Instructors: Cindy (volunteer) for craft classes, trips in the summer, outings, Health talks from Ottawa Public Health, Imam Zijad 
Synopsis of Program: Seniors have 2 events each month, every 2nd and 4th Sundays with various activities pertaining to their Social, Educational and Spiritual enrichment. 
Day and Time: 

2nd Sunday (5:00 pm – 8:00 pm) – dinner, exercise, and a presentation on health 

4th Sunday (3:00 pm – 5:00 pm) – tea and snacks, and socialization 
Location: SNMC Basement

string-array.name: alhuda
string-array.item:
Location @ Michaëlle-Jean Elementary School, 11 Claridge Dr (next to SNMC Masjid) 
Two main components to our program: 

1.Language Program (Arabic) 
Time: 9:30 am – 12:00 pm 

2. Qur’an and Islamic Studies Program 
Time: 12:00 – 2:45pm 
Credit Course: We also offer a language Credit Course for high school students that will count toward their high school credits: 9:30 am – 1:00 pm 
Arabic: Students learn the Arabic Alphabet, advance their communication skills and acquire different skills to understand and practice the Arabic language. 
Islamic Studies: Our program has a focus on mannerism, loving God and emulating the prophetic character.

string-array.name: sister
string-array.item:
Sisters’ Halaqa 

This program is for the sisters, run by sisters and done by sisters.It is open to all and any women and girls who are interested in gaining knowledge about Islam. 

When: Sundays from 10:30 am to 12:30pm 
Location: SNMC Musalla, 3131 Jockvale Road, Barrhaven 
1) 10:30am -11:15am: Tajweed and practice of recitation 
2) 11:15am to 12:30pm: Tafsir, presentations on varied topics, discussions and reflections. 

Sisters Saturday Night Program – Mark the 4th Saturday 4 Your Sisters 

The objective is to provide a forum for sisters to socialize, relax and enjoy each others company. At the same time, we increase in Islamic knowledge and practice; form and strengthen ties and promote sisterhood and community. We provide a platform for sisters to contribute their unique talents, knowledge and expertise to the masjid and community. We also have engaging activities such as nasheeds, poetry and Islamic quizzes.
